conversation.speaker: USER
conversation.text: I'm in the mood for a lgbt movie. Could you recommend a few?

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text: I'd highly recommend watching "Brokeback Mountain" and "My Own Private Idaho". The former is a powerful, award-winning film about two cowboys navigating their complex relationship in the American West, featuring an impressive cast including Heath Ledger and Jake Gyllenhaal. On the other hand, "My Own Private Idaho" is a thought-provoking journey of self-discovery, starring River Phoenix and Keanu Reeves as hustlers on the streets of Portland. Both films offer unique insights into LGBT experiences through captivating storytelling and memorable performances.

If you're looking for something more supernatural, "The Relic" might also be of interest as it combines elements of horror and adventure with an intriguing plot set in a Chicago museum. Enjoy the movies!

If you enjoy a bit of war drama with a dash of romance, I'd recommend "To Have and Have Not" (1937) starring Humphrey Bogart. It's set during World War II and follows an American expatriate helping the French Resistance.

If you're more into modern war dramas, "Hart's War" (2002) featuring Colin Farrell might be right up your alley. This film focuses on a law student turned lieutenant who defends a black prisoner of war falsely accused of murder during World War II.

Both movies offer captivating stories that explore the complexities of war and its effects on those who serve.
